1.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

2.text: The first month, the first day of the month, thou shalt set up the tabernacle of the testimony,

3.text: And shalt put the ark in it, and shalt let down the veil before it:

4.text: And thou shalt bring in the table, and set upon it the things that are commanded according to the rite. The candlestick shall stand with its lamps,

5.text: And the altar of gold whereon the incense is burnt, before the ark of the testimony. Thou shalt put the hanging in the entry of the tabernacle,

6.text: And before it the altar of holocaust:

7.text: The laver between the altar and the tabernacle, and thou shalt fill it with water.

8.text: And thou shalt encompass the court with hangings, and the entry thereof.

9.text: And thou shalt take the oil of unction and anoint the tabernacle with its vessels, that they may be sanctified:

10.text: The altar of holocaust and all its vessels:

11.text: The laver with its foot: thou shalt consecrate all with the oil of unction, that they may be most holy.

12.text: And thou shalt bring Aaron and his sons to the door of the tabernacle of the testimony, and having washed them with water,

13.text: Thou shalt put on them the holy vestments, that they may minister to me, and that the unction of them may prosper to an everlasting priesthood.

16.text: And Moses did all that the Lord had commanded.

17.text: So in the first month of the second year, the first day of the month, the tabernacle was set up.

18.text: And Moses reared it up, and placed the boards and the sockets and the bars, and set up the pillars,

19.text: And spread the roof over the tabernacle, putting over it a cover, as the Lord had commanded.

20.text: And he put the testimony in the ark, thrusting bars underneath, and the oracle above.

21.text: And when he had brought the ark into the tabernacle, he drew the veil before it to fulfil the commandment of the Lord.

22.text: And he set the table in the tabernacle of the testimony at the north side without the veil,

23.text: Setting there in order the loaves of proposition, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

24.text: He set the candlestick also in the tabernacle of the testimony over against the table on the south side,

25.text: Placing the lamps in order, according to the precept of the Lord.

26.text: He set also the altar of gold under the roof of the testimony over against the veil,

27.text: And burnt upon it the incense of spices, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

28.text: And he put also the hanging in the entry of the tabernacle of the testimony,

29.text: And the altar of holocaust of the entry of the testimony, offering the holocaust, and the sacrifices upon it, as the Lord had commanded.

30.text: And he set the laver between the tabernacle of the testimony and the altar, filling it with water.

31.text: And Moses and Aaron, and his sons washed their hands and feet,

32.text: When they went into the tabernacle of the covenant, and went to the altar, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

33.text: He set up also the court round about the tabernacle and the altar, drawing the hanging in the entry thereof. After all things were perfected,

34.text: The cloud covered the tabernacle of the testimony, and the glory of the Lord filled it.

35.text: Neither could Moses go into the tabernacle of the covenant, the cloud covering all things and the majesty of the Lord shining, for the cloud had covered all.

36.text: If at any time the cloud removed from the tabernacle, the children of Israel went forward by their troops:

37.text: If it hung over, they remained in the same place.

38.text: For the cloud of the Lord hung over the tabernacle by day, and a fire by night, in the sight of all the children of Israel throughout all their mansions.
